result.execSummary:
The defendant Johnnie Ray Hill was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Johnnie Ray Hill is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Johnnie Ray Hill was found guilty of Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Due to financial limitations, court waived all non-mandatory court costs and fees. Court ordered defendant to pay all mandatory court costs and fees and DNA surcharge by 09-25-15, or to be docketed as a civil judgment.
Consecutive to: Any other sentence; STRAIGHT TIME

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.   
AS TO COUNT 1: The Court ordered defendant to serve 90 days in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 79 days time served, STRAIGHT TIME. 

- Due to financial limitations Court WAIVED all non-mandatory court costs and fees.
- Court ordered defendant to pay all mandatory court costs and fees and DNA surcharge by 09-25-2015, or to be docketed as a civil judgment.

Filed;
-Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
-Pretrial Incarceration Credit.

Defendant Johnnie Ray Hill in court, in custody with attorney Terese M. Dick.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.  

AS TO COUNT 1: Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the criminal complaint and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Defendant further advised that if hee is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  

AS TO COUNT 2:  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered case dismissed.

Attorney Terese M. Dick in court, defendant Johnnie Ray Hill not in court, in custody and not produced.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: TC.  Case calendared for projected guilty plea and sentencing.   Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 37.   Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 25, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Johnnie Ray Hill in court with attorney Terese M. Dick.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: TC.  Defense counsel has received discovery and offer. Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 37. Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 11, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  
Defendant to have no contact with: WAL-MART, S. 27TH St.

Defendant Johnnie Ray Hill in court with attorney Terese M. Dick.  Defendant Johnnie Ray Hill in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
